channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Grass over ran the pavement, 22nd May
item.description:
The public pavement from twigworth green to norton school has been became over grown woth hedges and the grass verge has moved onto the pavement making it very difficult to fit a pramnor wheel chair on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A38, Twigworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety risk of fencing, 22nd May
item.description:
Fencing that I believe was used to contain bark for honeybourne line works, and doesn't seem to be serving a purpose anymore, was strewn across the path acting as trip or entanglement hazard. Can someone please remove or reinstate the fencing if still has a purpose to remove risk to people, dogs and wildlife.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle lanes blocked by vehicles pulling out, 22nd May
item.description:
The new design of the adjoining roads junction means that cars now will stop in cycle lane to assess whether it’s safe to pull out. this has resulted in multiple near misses where cars pulled out not checking for cyclists in the cycle lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hill Court Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ramp on mini roundabout, 22nd May
item.description:
When going north from the mini roundabout there is a sharp ramp from one road surface to another. This should be smoothed out to prevent vehicle damage
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Vehicles abandoned on grass, 22nd May
item.description:
Vehicles are constantly abandoned on the newly planted grass that was installed as part of the cycle way scheme. Please can you make these verges inaccessible and in doing so prevent the vehicles?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 131, Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Campervan and caravan parked off Hucclecote Road, 22nd May
item.description:
Hi, I would like to report that a run-down motorhome (with limited sanitary/cooking) facilities has been parked off Hucclecote Road for a number of months now. Further to this a dilapidated caravan (with broken windows and holes in the side) has also turned up in the past week. This caravan looks uninhabitable but I am not sure if anyone is using it, or if it has just been dumped there. The motorhome on the other hand does have a single male occupant. I am concerned that more caravans/motorhomes may start to turn up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Road, Brockworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree limbs overhanging path and falling., 22nd May
item.description:
Outside 1 Abbots Leys Road, GL54 5QE I have been reporting this since 2013. The tree is overgrown, almost reaches the windows of my house (I have disabilities and am unable to cut it myself). Every year it pushes against overhead wires and large branches fall onto the path (this is a main path to and from primary school, and I have to walk under it every time I leave my property) and into the road. Eventually it will cause an injury to someone, damage a car or break the overhead cables. Please cut it back. It has been an issue for over 10 years now. Eventually

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbots Leys Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
